nodes.text:
/// Communications Open ///

Attend at once...

branches.responseText: Oh, this can't good.

nodes.text: Commander {Commander.LastName}, we have got to here due to your failure to aid us in this situation. The Crimson Council are very displeased with your performance.

Over what we have heard, you have more problems than missing a few sides of beef or packets of seeds. Bands of Mercenaries blowing up installations, a traitorous Governor and civil unrest that looks like open rebellion.

branches.responseText: ... and so much for the acclaimed MIM.

nodes.text: The MIM are the preeminent information organization in the this or any other Galaxy and I would caution you that their reach is vast.

branches.responseText: Then why are Mercenaries running amok without you know who they are? And, your elected officials trying to start another war?

nodes.text: You need more than us to solve your situation. From our point view it looks like you set us up to fail in the first place. You are lucky this hasn't reached the MRB otherwise they would have to convene a Contract Grievance session.

branches.responseText: It still might...

nodes.text: I wouldn't think that it would be necessary. As we are outside the MRB's purview it would jeopardise your Reputation with them. As this was issued under the Seal of the Crimson Council, it is sealed as such. You are lucky that you maintain your Magistracy Of Canopus reputation as we couldn't really go to the MRB with this failure now could we?

branches.responseText: I guess not.

nodes.text: As you still have no idea behind who is behind all this, there is a definite chance we'll meet them again - on our terms this time.

branches.responseText: We'll leave you with that thought Lady Cunningham... Darius, let's find some 'Honest' Mercenary work.

nodes.text: All of a sudden I feel the hankering for anything but Beef...

branches.responseText: Let's go!

nodes.text: We need to get a handle on who's who in this crap shoot. We had 'Mech with similar markings shooting each other that well... I'm not sure who was supposed to be the target.

branches.responseText: Why do I get the distinct feeling this is more of a family affair?

nodes.text: The Countess didn't seem too happy to see the Baron.

branches.responseText: Are they related?

nodes.text: Not yet anyway

branches.responseText: Can we salvage anything?

nodes.text: I would have expected a little more animosity given their history.

branches.responseText: How long has this really been an issue?

nodes.text: Interesting you ask, the escalation has only been over the last few months. Started with one blaming the other for the contract failures, loss of livestock and equipment destruction. But this was more like a military operation designed to go after key people more than equipment.

branches.responseText: This is getting nasty.

nodes.text: Look, the damage so far is slight and the only real casualties are the 'Hired Guns' and the loss of a few 'Mechs.

branches.responseText: Lucky that was all.
What of the Countess?
Sorry about Badger
Let's get on with what we came to do.

nodes.text: The Countess has been recovered along with her 'Mech. Both are pretty banged up. Her Clint might be just scrap but you are welcome to it.

branches.responseText: I doubt even Yang would bother with that lost cause... No thanks.
Yang would be sulking for a week if I didn't accept... Yes Please.

nodes.text: Our intelligence services are going over the battlefield as we speak. The previous actions by these 'Mechs were a nuisance but nothing like this.

branches.responseText: Hopefully something useful

nodes.text: And.... we are now refereeing family Births, Deaths and Marriages.? Why are the 'in-laws-to-be' arguing and why the gun fights? Surely who marries who is up to the lucky couple?

branches.responseText: Yeah, We were invited here as Judge, Jury and Executioner.

nodes.text: It's a little more complicated than that, I'm afraid. In Canopian culture, the woman asks the man - really informs him - that they will be married. He really doesn't have much to say about it. Her Mother - The Countess D'Froness - absolutely is opposed to the marriage.

branches.responseText: <sigh...!>Almost scared to ask why.

nodes.text: It's the age old issue - Nobility and Class. Three major factions make up the Canopian noble class [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreFroness],The Froness]], [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDurachi],The Durachi]] and [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreGirin],The Girin]].  The Duchess is Froness and the Baron, while still entitled to the title of Baron is Girin. The Duchess holds that the Girin are nothing but “jumped-up commoners” and mere pretenders.

branches.responseText: And hell... no daughter of hers would dare marry below her station.

nodes.text: It's even deeper than that. Nobody can become Froness, not even by Marriage but their offspring ... well, you get the picture.

branches.responseText: Bloody succession politics...Lets move on to real work.

nodes.text: Aye Commander. Has anything be done about locating the missing Governor?

We have been going over his office records and conversation logs and to date there is nothing.
REMOVE BEFORE PUBLISHING
(He is an elector and the Indiri Consortium what to place one of their own as an Elector by affecting the popular election)

branches.responseText: Farah, have we made any in-roads in that direction?

nodes.text: Sorry Boss the host star is washing out the emergence sensor due to it's X-ray emissions. All I can tell you is that nothing has left the surface since our arrival.

The [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreMIM],MIM]] are still investigating but nothing as yet.  There are two operations that we need you to assist with, as we only have local vehicles, keeping the whoever is behind this from taking control of them. So, we need you relieve them. If you choose one I can better direct our forces to support the other.  Review and choose Commander.

branches.responseText: <color=#6DF240FF>[REVIEW Operation 1]</color> Protect the Beef Exports
<color=#6DF240FF>[REVIEW Operation 2]</color>Defend the Meat processing Cryo Facilities.
We're ready...

nodes.text: I was right! We're babysitting again.

branches.responseText: Can it Yang. What's the details?

nodes.text: We have charted a DropShip to meet you at the designated landing area where it will transport the Beef exports and vehicles to our Spaceport in the Capital. We can expect some resistance but in the current circumstances we are only guessing who is shooting at who. If they shoot the vehicles then shoot them first, if they shoot you then that's good. Protect the exports at all costs.

branches.responseText: Let's review the other one.

nodes.text: This a very important facility and it must remain at least functional. It will take months to bring this facility back online if you don't protect it from damage. Who's who out there is anyone guess. If they shoot the buildings , shoot them first. If they shoot you then they are not shooting the buildings - which is a good thing.

branches.responseText: Let's review the other one.

nodes.text: Okay Commander, pull the trigger and let's get this started.

branches.responseText: <color=#6DF240FF>[FLASHPOINT CHOICE:  Operation 1]</color> Protect the Beef Exports and Vehicles.
<color=#6DF240FF>[FLASHPOINT CHOICE: Operation 2.]</color>Defend the Meat processing Cryo Facilities.

nodes.text: Good Luck Commander.

branches.responseText: hummmm - we'll see...

nodes.text: I did warn you. You are lucky she only got a little burnt and bruised or you would have been face the wrath of the entire Froness. You would never work in the Magistracy of Canopus ever again.

branches.responseText: I'd be careful on who you threaten Or, sanction activities you can't control.

nodes.text: Oh, I can control more than just that.

branches.responseText: I'd like to see you try.

nodes.text: Leanora... stop that!. The Commander is trying to help and besides you and I both know that this ancient 'caste' system you are trying to defend is broken. It was her to go with the Commander and I glad she did, otherwise you probably would still be lying in a disabled 'Mech at the mercy of those animals. Whether you like it or not, I'll still be marrying your daughter.

branches.responseText: ... and she is very ummm... insistent. I could stop her.

nodes.text: ...and I'd Iike to see anyone try to stop her.

branches.responseText: Agreed

nodes.text: Well, if that wasn't a severe cluster fu...

branches.responseText: now,now XO. Delicate ears and all.

nodes.text: ...k There were so many idiots running around it was even difficult to get situational awareness even from up here.

branches.responseText: Let's get focused people - Farah you first.

nodes.text:
I have unscrambled most of that garbled mess and there is more here and very interesting than I was prepared to accept.
This was the leader - Call sign - The FIxer
"Switching to I.C BattleCom... (...the rest of the transmission is garbled...) Right my little stingers, let's clean this mess up. The Boss is none to happy about the attention this is getting. Time to 'clean house'...leave no witnesses."

branches.responseText: Good Work Farah - did Darius come up with the scramble key?

nodes.text: We had it all the time - remember this is a Star League era Exploration DropShip and the Comms suite is very extensive. The scramble key was from an older, and I thought, extinct communication platform. Long story, but sufficed to say any communication using this cipher shouldn't exist and especially not these rouges.

branches.responseText: Another time maybe.... whats's rest.
Any More?
So, this is more than just a spat over resources it seems

nodes.text: We agree Commander {Commander.LastName}, and I'm certainly glad The Countess is unharmed as well as her Daughter.

branches.responseText: And the.... Baron, is marrying...

nodes.text: ...the daughter, if I heard correctly? I suppose that was supposed to be a secret?

branches.responseText: sigh...! and Mother doesn't approve I suppose? That never gets old.

roots.comment: We can side load this convesation for a failure and bug out
This a coaleseing of the above conversations
